div.p: V62/2978, unit 749, VPRS 1189/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to transmit to you an application, made to me by the Curator of the Beechworth Athenaeum,
W. Morton to M, 1 May 1862. that a copy of my work on Victorian plants
B62.03.03. may be granted to that institution, and beg to recommend the application to your favorable consideration.

On 9 May 1862 the Under Secretary, J. Moore, asked the Government Printer, J. Ferres, to report on the application. Ferres replied on 15 May: ''Only 500 copies of this work have been printed, and if this application is acceded to similar demand will no [or not?] doubt be made from all parts of the Colony.' Moore instructed on 19 May: 'Inform Dr Mueller that the number of Copies printed is too small to permit of the distribution of the Work to Public Institutions of this nature all of whom no doubt would apply for it if known that it had been given to one.'
Letter to Direc: Bot: Gard: | May 22 62 L177.' Get copy if it is at PRO.
